paragraphs.body: Avatar Legends was a site dedicated to the original ${link_0} TV series, its film adaptation, ${link_1}, and ${link_2}. This community offered everything from discussion about the shows and comics to the opportunity to write fanfiction.
paragraphs.text: Avatar Legends was a site dedicated to the original Avatar: The Last Airbender TV series, its film adaptation, The Last Airbender, and The Legend of Korra. This community offered everything from discussion about the shows and comics to the opportunity to write fanfiction.

paragraphs.body: First launched in early 2012, the community was started on a free web hosting forum service called "forumotion", and has since grown to have over five thousand users. It was run by administrators Zephyr, AvatarToXic, Jagroar, Awepicbender, Ms9222, Llave, Azure, ArcherLeon, Melanie, Azulon, and JamesLegend. These users provided technical skills, graphics design, and moderation to make it a successful site.
paragraphs.text: First launched in early 2012, the community was started on a free web hosting forum service called "forumotion", and has since grown to have over five thousand users. It was run by administrators Zephyr, AvatarToXic, Jagroar, Awepicbender, Ms9222, Llave, Azure, ArcherLeon, Melanie, Azulon, and JamesLegend. These users provided technical skills, graphics design, and moderation to make it a successful site.

paragraphs.body: In March 2013, the community moved to dedicated hosting and renewed itself, presenting a brand new design, greater functionality, and user groups among its new features. Catering to Avatar fans, it provided its own podcast, called AL Podcast, downloadable episodes, clips, comics, and tons of other amazing content.
paragraphs.text: In March 2013, the community moved to dedicated hosting and renewed itself, presenting a brand new design, greater functionality, and user groups among its new features. Catering to Avatar fans, it provided its own podcast, called AL Podcast, downloadable episodes, clips, comics, and tons of other amazing content.

paragraphs.body: The staff decided to shut down the site on January 1, 2015 and replaced it with a portal redirecting all users to AvatarLegends' social network sites, where most of the community resided. Domain ownership of the site and the social networks was transferred to ArcherLeon on February 8, 2015, in prospect of a new Avatar series.
paragraphs.text: The staff decided to shut down the site on January 1, 2015 and replaced it with a portal redirecting all users to AvatarLegends' social network sites, where most of the community resided. Domain ownership of the site and the social networks was transferred to ArcherLeon on February 8, 2015, in prospect of a new Avatar series.

paragraphs.body: On February 8, 2016, Avatarlegends.net became up for sale as the staff members parted ways.
